description:
I received a gift card from a family member to this Peruvian restaurant for my birthday! I quickly made reservations in advance but it was honestly a little tough to find a good time/date because it was so busy. What a cute place though!! A handful of tables inside, very very pristine and welcoming, with great smells drafting out onto the sidewalk as you walk in. I don't spend a lot of time in Bernal Heights but I'm glad I got out here for this place.

To start we ordered drinks, the infamous sangria and the anchor steam beer. The sangria was absolutely wonderful and I highly recommend getting the pitcher if you have 2 or more people wanting to drink it. For food, we ordered:

Cebiche Pescado $17.5 - Fresh Fish of the day, Aji Rocoto leche de tigre
Pulpito Bebe $15.5 - baby octopus, papitas dorada & ocopa
Paella Negra with Squid Ink $26 - Peruvian style seafood paella with Arborio rice in pimento-saffron base
Aji De Gallina $20 - Shredded chicken breast stewed in aji Amarillo sauce with potato, Botija olive, egg & side of steamed Jasmine rice

Everything was delicious and the portions were large, even the smaller plates on the menu that we ate as appetizers. Our server was nice and helpful, and he came back several times throughout the meal to check on us and it always seemed to be perfect timing - when we needed water refills or we were ready to order another drink.

We'll be back!
author: Bri T.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday with a friend to catch up. Right away we could tell the service was a little...off. We either felt rushed or ignored.

Food was ok. We ordered the lomo saltado and paella. The meat in the lomo saltado was a bit rough and chewy. The paella was a bit over cooked. The rice was very soft and mushie.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
When you first walk in to Piqueo's it's easy to quickly settle in to the quaint and warm atmosphere.  Simple, intimate, eclectic but not overstated. We were seated in tight quarters in the back - small area (but we were not uncomfortable).  However, if you make a reservation ahead of time I would suggest trying to get a table in the main (front) room.  This restaurant definitely deserves four stars for both the food and service.  But be warned that it's pricey (as reflected in the $$$ on the Yelp! description).  So, be prepared.  If the servings sizes were larger i wouldn't blink at the prices but these dishes are intricate and small.  Our dinner for 5 was $269 (and the tip was included in our bill...so if going with a group make sure you check that).  We ordered a pitcher of Sangria and it was enough for maybe 5 1/2 (not full) glasses.  In addition, I think the boys got a couple beers after and then 1 more glass of sangria.  We also ordered about 5-6 tapas plates and 2 entrees, which again are very small portions. 

Tapas:
Costillita de Res $15 - looked yummy but didn't try.
Pastelito de Choclo $12.50 - by far one of my favorite dishes.  Sweet and yummy.
Bolitas de Yucca $13 - 3 yucca balls, nice texture, interesting flavor.
Tequenos $13 - another of my favorites
Humita Dulce $13.50 - a table favorite

Entrees:
Arroz Chaufa $20 - Chinese inspired fried rice (I didn't try this)
Lomo Saltado $21 - very good but again a very small portion for the price.

2 Desserts
Passion Fruit Panama Cotta $9 - AMAZING
Another dessert - fried banana thing (don't remember the name of it).

I would definitely go back but probably not with a group (unless a special occasion).
author: Rachael C.

description: Firts time coming to this Peruvian restaurant.   Nice and fast service, delicious food, comfortable spaces (tables). Ambiental music, nice and clean restroom, the only 4 start is because the parking can be the issue .  But everything else was very good.  I will definitely come back.
author: Jose N.

description:
I'm rarely in the Bernal Heights area.  Piqueos gives me a reason to visit more often.  With friendly service, refreshing Sangria, and captivating Peruvian flavors ...it's a no-brainer to come back.

At one point, our table looked very picturesque with all the vibrant colors of our small plates.  These tapas we shared include Chicharrones, Cebiche Pescado, Pulpito Bebe (baby octopus), sauteed spinach, squid ink Paella, beef hearts and chicken skewers.  The sauces in these were rich in color and taste.  
We also had the pan seared scallops...perfectly cooked and full of flavor.  I really wanted to order another plate for myself.  But I got hooked with the purple mashed potatoes - a pleasant accompaniment.     
For dessert, the passion fruit panna cotta won me over with it's creamy texture and arroz con leche sauce.  It's been a while since I've had really good panna cotta, like this.    
 
I really need to find my way back to Bernal Heights. And when I do, Piqueos will be my first stop.  Those entrees are calling for me!  And of course, a pitcher of Sangria!
author: Bobby L.

description: We've been here before but the second time around is even better. One of the things I love about San Francisco are restaurants like this, kinda hidden, good food and great service. If you've never tried Peruvian food, this place is wonderful, located in Bernal Heights. We loved everything we ate. It's a great place to go before you catch a concert like what we did ( we were headed to see Gene Loves Jezebel At the DNA Lounge), food is not too heavy and the service is fast. We didn't even have a reservation. They even gave us the best private table in the restaurant, at the very back.
author: DJ Nocturna R.

description: Affordable, delicious, lively. We walked by this place and stopped in for a drink -- ended up eating dinner. Would definitely go back!
author: Alex O.

description:
We were across the street doing happy hour when I decided to see what restaurants had openings for dinner and drinks. When Piqueo's popped up, I decided to take it. I made a reservation through OpenTable about 10 mins prior for a party of four on Saturday, March 31st at 5:45pm. We were wrapping up our meal at the current spot, so I called over to let them know we were running a little late. I ended up heading over first after we settled our bill.

*Cebiche Pescado: Fresh Fish of the day, Aji Rocoto leche de tigre ($17.50)
*Anticuches (skewers): Marinated in panca served with crispy potatoes & huacatay, Beef heart x1, Chicken x1 ($13.50 each)
*Chicharrones: Slightly fried cebiche marinated base, salsa criolla & rocoto aioli, Chicken ($14)
*Scallops Ficho: Pan seared Dayboat scallops, purple mashed potatoes, toasted nori & tongarashi ($17)
*Pulpito Bebe: Baby octopus, papitas dorada & ocopa ($15.50)
*Paella: Peruvian style seafood paella with Arborio rice in pimento-saffron base, Negra: with Squid ink ($26)
*Sauteed Spinach: with garlic ($7)
*Passion Fruit Panna Cotta: with arroz con leche sauce ($10)
*Alfaiores: 2 Peruvian cookies filled with Dulce de Leche ($9)
*Sangria: Red wine, Sparkling wine, fresh fruit and fruit juice ($32 pitcher)
*Ochoa Moscatel (sweet) '13, Spain ($9)
*Porto Feist - Tawny 10 Yr ($9)
*Organic Peruvian Coffee ($4)

Since I was left alone with a drink menu, I decided to get a pitcher of sangria. This was rather good. Not too fruity or sweet and nicely balanced. The glasses come with fruit inside, so it's not sitting in the sangria the whole time. My favorites of the dishes were the octopus and the beef heart. The octopus was tender with a slight chew. The beef heart nice and meaty. When we ordered the chicken, we actually thought it was chicken heart, so we were a little disappointed when it was just chicken. Our fault for not reading the menu correctly. I like a good paella, but I've found I'm not a huge fan of squid ink. It adds an earthiness I don't exactly like. But one of my girlfriends loves it, so I just deferred. We also got complimentary Purple potato chips and salsa, but I couldn't try them due to my deep fried food ban. I also couldn't try the chicharrones, which looked tasty. Out of the desserts, I enjoyed the panna cotta. Creamy, rich, and smooth. The after dinner drinks were small pours, but I wanted another drink, so my port did the trick. I did noticed we were charged $9.50 each instead of $9, so they really need to update their menu if they did a price increase.

I adore Peruvian food so I'm glad I was finally able to check this spot out.
author: Elena N.

description: Cute little restaurant on Bernal's Cortland village ! To start off , the chips/salsa  was great. The Corn cake with queso along with the chutneys was ridiculously good. The side of fried chick peas was perfect crunchy and didn't feel oily. Our entree pan seared Ahi with roasted banana with rice was super tasty! The passion fruit panna cotta was tarty for my  taste buds but some might like it ?! Over all a pretty solid place to check out!
author: Raja K.

description:
If all Peruvian food is this good, I'm gonna skitter off like a rat and abandon this sinking ship of a country and head south. Peru here I come! We began with an appetizer special of steamed mussels with
a lime cilantro sauce that was a light, refreshing way to start. Next, we moved on to the Aji de Gallina, stewed chicken breast in a creamy aji amarillo sauce, and served with marinated olives, a hard boiled egg and jasmine rice. It was a great dish, that reminded me vaguely of a yellow curry apple chicken dish my mother used to make. For a dish with a cream based sauce, it was rich, without being heavy. We followed that with the Churrasco, a medium rare New York steak served with chimichurri sauce and a side of yucca fries. The meat was cooked as ordered, which I was quite happy about, since I've been let done by quite a few restaurants in that department lately. I would have been pleased enough with it on its own at that point, but the chimichurri sauce brought it up a level from merely delicious to outstandingly exquisite. My wife ordered the 2016 Blanco Nivea Verdejo from Rueda, which she described as delicious- reasonably priced, and tasted much more expensive than it was. We had planned on getting dessert, but were too rotund to try try adding anything, even a Python-esque wafer thin mint. In addition to the amazing food, the staff was delightful- helpful, pleasant and attentive, without being intrusive. Overall, 6 stars out of 5.
author: Daniel F.

description:
Best baby octopus appetizer I ever had! The red sauce compliments the octopus so well. The lamb rack was super tender and quite yum. The beef hearts were too dry and hard to chew, not my taste.

Pitchers of sangria were awesome, although you feel guilty as you realize the amount of sugar you've just consumed! 

For desert we got the flan with some sauce that had bits of quinoa, gave the dish an interesting texture! 

Will try the paella next time!
author: Vasu S.

description: You can find Piqueo's in the middle of the very quaint neighborhood of Bernal Heights. Piqueo's has fine, exotic and ethnic Peruvian food with a great Latino casual chill ambiance.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Good food comes from small kitchens.

This was our second time here in the past 6 months. this time her ladyship requested we go here with 6 other family members.

Eight of us for dinner and we ate family style. We had at least the following, all of which were delicious. Pallta Rellena a delicious stuffed avacado. Tamal Ficha which has duck confit and olives. Churrasco - a NY Strip dish. Salmon Andino, Empanada. Adobo a delicious pork shoulder dish and Braised Lamb Shanks.

Every single dish was fantastic. The plainest ,meaning least flavorful, was the lamb shank.

My two outstanding favorites were the Pallta Rellena and the Adobo. Others were equally excellent but three days later these are the ones I recall the most.

I noticed the restaurant has earned a Michelin recommendation. Get here quickly before they get their Michelin Star and two things happen: 1 They will get even more busy and you will need reservations months in advance. As it is we made ours weeks in  advance. and 2. They will justifiably increase their prices.

The wines, I am  not a wine drinker at all, were very well enjoyed by all.

Regarding price feeding 8 adults is not a cheap experience in most places. So estimate $45 a head including wine. Eating with a large group is a great idea as you get to taste so many more dishes than just eating as a couple.

In the heart of Bernal Heights this is a rare find.
author: Peter K.

description:
Small spot (tables very close together) in Bernal Heights neighborhood. 

Great wine list, and really fresh food. Tapas style, so all of it's shareables. 

We ordered probably 7 different plates...all were tasty. And I was so full!
author: Amy O.

description: This is probably the best Peruvian restaurant in town! The service is really good and the food as well, my favorite dessert is the alfajores typical from Peru, It's hard to find a place with the same quality on food and especially quality service, always welcome with a warmly smile, if you are in San Francisco and you are looking for amazing  food this is your place!
author: AndresFernando N.

description: The food is so tasty and delicious the servers are super nice and friendly and great hosts!
author: Lourdes M.

description:
Food four stars. Service two stars. Took someone from out of town, and I had remembered Piqueos as SO friendly. Service has taken a sharp turn to sour and moody, at least from the two servers who helped us. It made the experience of this neighborhood restaurant much less pleasing. When I asked questions about two tuna appetizers, the server was impatient and unhelpful. I felt rushed and made the wrong decision (tuna tartar: it has a sickening sweet/sour sauce). There is so much arrogant service in SF, I really was looking forward to the unusually helpful and fun servers of years past. No way. Not now.

The scallops were yummy, pork decent. But I won't be as excited about visiting again. My friend did like it, but I only put up with snooty service when it's out-of-this world food.
author: Katharine H.

description:
16.00.00               1st Visit

Food ------------------------------ 4.5 solid
Service --------------------------- 4

Forgotten review...
I remembered that ALL of the dishes was very good.
Well executed ... no weak point ... place was kinda dark.
It's one of my Rare Highly Recommend place.
All us couldn't stop talking about the dishes ... sign of great food

rough draft
author: S.K. Y.

description:
First of all, one disclaimer. I am one of those obnoxious Peruvians that when they go to a Peruvian restaurant, nothing really satisfy them. Comments like 'this doesn't do justice to the real thing' or 'not the same' are not uncommon. If they don't say it out loud, they are definitely thinking it. 

Having said that, Piqueos is amazing. It is the real thing and the mix of many different and rich flavours are definitely noticed here. Yes, like home!

We started by ordering a couple of glasses of wine. One tempranillo and one malbec. Usually when one goes to a restaurant, you can tell where the owner is making his money. Mediocre wine that you can tell you can buy the whole bottle for the price of one glass. While probably the economics of the wine we drank was the same at Piqueos, the quality of the wine was a lot better than the average. One can tell they spent a lot of time selecting them and both were very distinctive and complex with long lasting taste. The wine selection was just a nice introduction to de dedication to details I noticed to the whole dining experience. 

As for the food, some general comments. Piqueos is closer to a tapas bar than to a large meal restaurant. The have a long selection and the good news is that even though it is tapas, the portions are not in miniature like other tapas bars I have visited. 

We had a Quinoa salad that was really good. Each of the ingredients were super fresh and it had a semi sweet balsamic that made it delicious. 

We also had the grilled hongos that cooked perfectly, which were accompanied by some arugula and a tartar sauce (similar to a mayonnaise but better). 

The scallops were amazing. Grilled and not overcooked, just tender and tasty as they should be on a bed of lentils that added flavour to the dish without overpowering.  

We tried the Tequeños with avocado as well. It is a rather simple dish, but every time I try it, they always mess it up because people tend to make them in a hurry. I asked for them not for the flavour but as a point of comparison with other restaurants. That was not the case in Piqueos and I liked them a lot because they literally brought me childhood memories. That reinforced my belief that the staff at Piqueos are really paying attention to all the details. 

The baby octopus was fantastic. Not too chewy, not too hard. They were just right and they are served with a fantastic sauce inspired in the anticuchos one can find in Lima. 

The last dish was a corn cake, which was made with choclo grains (Peruvian corn), potato and cheese. Really memorable. 

All in all a really good experience and I will be coming back to try the rest of the dishes in the menu.
author: Rodrigo B.

description:
Loved there service and the waitress/hostess was very polite and let us take our time with the menu. The food was delicious and seasoning was on point!  
I'd definitely come back to order more of the entrees but today it was more tapas and sides!
author: Sandra R.

description:
We used to love Piqueo's and would come a couple times a month. Somehow we got out of practice however and hadn't gone for quite awhile until my wife suggested we go tonight. Sadly, this will probably be our last time there.

What used to be a great neighborhood gem with an inspired kitchen, is now just a mediocre Peruvian place with OK food and below average service. I suspect this may be due to new management but am not sure. In any event, they've dramatically increased the prices and decreased the food quality. Several of our favorite dishes are gone and the ones that remain have clearly been revised for cost savings. The service is slow and inconsistent - which wouldn't bother me so much if I wasn't paying so much for it now. 

Goodbye Piqueo's. It was great while it lasted!
author: Joseph S.

description: Maybe the best food I've ever had. Honestly. We order 4 appetizers(I missed getting a picture of the first one) and I don't know if they planned for them all to come out one right after the other, giving us just enough time to eat the one we had before the next one came out, but it was perfect. The service was great. The chefs even waved to us as we left. Truly a great place. Amazing amazing amazing. You will not regret going here.
author: Sierra H.

description: If you want amazingly delicious Peruvian food!!! This is your place great cozy ambiance good service super friendly staff and just superb food!!! A gem in the Bernal Heights district! I can't wait to go back!!!!
author: amy h.

description: Awesome tapas! Nice chill vibe. Good service. Great for seafood, meat or vegetarians.
author: Vicki L.

description: A Cebiche to start your meal and a Passion Panna Cotta as a Dessert to end up, will be the perfect Dinner, they are both amazing, today I tried the "Pastelito de Choclo" or "Corn Cake" and "Bolitas de Yucca" or "Crispy Yucca Balls" to make my dinner even better. Nice staff & service
author: Santos C.

description:
So good. I was in the neighborhood a few months back, and while I had time to spare, I walked up and down Cortland Ave. I run a restaurant back home, so I like walking and looking at other restaurants and the unique presences they have. I smelled Piqueo's before I even saw the place. It swept me off my feet. Unfortunately, I was not able to go that night, but a month and a half later, I came back with my family. And wow, it didn't disappoint at all. 

The Sanguchoń was phenominal. 

The Anticucho de Corazón was so flavorful and wonderfully tender.

The Arroz con Pato wasn't the greatest, but it was still delicious. The duck didn't stand out of the dish as a whole to us, but still great flavors. Maybe if the duck was seared crispy.

The Flan with the Quinoa Sauce was whoa. Really delightful and just a great way to end on top of all the wonderful flavors we had.

Will come back here again next time I'm in town.

The customer service was wonderful! They gave great recommendations and were super friendly and patient with us.
author: Ren H.

description:
Thank goodness for good food, great company, and reservations with Piqueo's.

In celebration for my boyfriend's birthday, I assembled a squad of 11 (including birthday boy) to dine on a Saturday night. When we arrived, we barely fit around 3 small tables--thank goodness again for great company ;)

After playing people tetris, the next objective was to order for our large party. Fortunately, my friends aren't too picky, so I asked my friend for a pen and began marking up their paper menu as if I was at a dimsum place (much to the surprise of the waiter hahaha). As I was scribbling down numbers, our party ordered their delightful, fruit-filled sangria to get the party started ($8 for a glass, $28 for a pitcher). 1 pitcher came out to 1 glass per person, so we had to order a few to quench the thirst.

To make it easier to share, we ordered 2 of each dish, with 8 dishes and 2 sides total. And EVERYTHING was ON-POINT. Tender meat, flavorful sauces, and hearty, hearty portions.

$12 SANGUCHÓN: pulled pork spareribs BBQ, coleslaw, peruano, potato chips, Panorama bun, and fried potatoes.
-Holy this is SUCH a good sandwich. We considered ordering another round.

$11 BOLITAS DE YUCCA: crispy yucca balls stuffed with ham and cheese, aji amarillo sauce, and berros.
-Tasty! Like upgraded potato balls from Porto's Bakery.

(Weekend special) $13 CHICHARRONES DE CALAMARI: fried calamari with salsa criolla and rocoto aioli.
-Aioli is addicting.

(Weekend special) $21 CEVICHE TRIO: shrimp, ahi tuna, and baby octopus ceviche in leche de tigre.
-Freeeeeessssshhhh.

$11 POBRECITO: tacu-tacu (rice and bean cake), plantain, sunny-side-up egg, and salsa criolla.
-Interesting! Not my favorite though.

$18 AJI DE GALLINA: shredded chicken breast stewed in aji Amarillo sauce with potato, Botija olive, hard-boiled egg, and side of steamed Jasmine rice.
-Tender juicy chicken in a curry-esque sauce.

$19 LOMO SALTADO: stir-fried beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, and soy sauce, served with fries and rice (add fried egg for $2).
-The generous pour-over of sauce makes this dish salty and rich. While I question the authenticity of this dish, the fries on top are unique! Pro tip: mix extra rice into the remaining sauce.

$20 ARROZ CON PATO: duck paella, soffrito, cilantro-beer base, choclo and pimento with huancaina sauce.
-A favorite. Fall-off-the-bone duck meat and spiced rice.

$22 PAELLA: Peruvian-style seafood paella with Aborio rice, pimento, and safrron base (negra paella cooked in squid ink base.
-So good, but duck paella was even better.

$7 YUCCA FRIES: yucca fries.
-Can't go wrong with yucca fries. I think it's the same aioli that comes with the chicharrones.

$6 PLATANO FRITTO: fried plantains.
-Can't go wrong with plantains.

(complimentary) $8.50 SUSPIRO A LA LIMEÑA: dulce de leche with pisco whipped cream.

What are the must-haves? The sanguchón and the arroz con pato. On-point Peruvian food.

Generous portions with fabulous service at a price point that came out $53 pp after tax and tip (20% for parties of 6 or more), on top of being able to book reservations? No excuse not to go.
author: Adele F.

description: We came here on a friday night for a romantic dinner for two. The resturant is small tucked away on the main street of bernal heights. The kitchen is in the front of the restaurant and greets you as you walk in. The space is long with menu items painted on the walls. The vibe is casual and refined. We had made reservations and were sat down right away. The waitstaff was very professional and all of the servers helped us not just our server. The menu was mostly tapas and small plates. There were a handful of other large plates or entree to select. We started off with some wine, both in the mid price range at 15 dollars a glass. The quality of the wine was quite good though, I got the tempranillo and my boyfriend the malbec. We shared the Andes salad which didn't have much queso fresco though did have a tasty dressing. We then had the baby octopus, which were very small and wonderfully tender, followed by the tequenos which were full of cheese and topped with powdered sugar. We shared the fried mushrooms which were deep fried goodness with a spicey mayonnaise based sauce. We also shared the pan seared scallops which were perfectly cooked on top of blue mashed potatoes. We finished it off with corncake that was full of cheesy deliciousness.  It was a little more costly than most restaurants though the food and the experience was great. I would definitely come back.
author: Anne S.

description:
Absolutely beautiful presentation and the food is magical! Oh my gosh. 

We literally just stopped by to taste "suspiro" for the first time because I'm getting married in the Dominican Republic and my cake is being frosted with suspiro frosting. 

Well, the suspiro was so good we ordered tapas. The stuffed avocado with "cebiche" (yes it's ceviche spelled wrong on the menu, but it's so cute) is excellent! We sat at the bar and watched the kitchen work and it was awesome!  They take such great pride in their work and even the sous chef is on point! 

We loved it and we WILL be back!
author: Milan F.

description: This is a wonderful Peruvian restaurant that I would recommend to anyone who likes this type of cuisine. I previously lived in Bernal Heights, and although this place is a bit pricey, the food and service is top notch.
author: Todd M.

description:
This is a FABULOUS autentic Peruvian Restaurant !!

Great ambiance. Temperature was great, even if it was a very cold night.

The plates are exquisit and a big portions very balance on spices and diferent choices. I had been there more than 10 times. It is one of my favorite places to recommend in SF.
I recently went without reservation and We sat at the bar....the view of the preparation was a  great show...I was observing different plates and how clean the chefs are...they dropped a spon and right away they put on the sink.
I left my dog in the car, even knowing  She is a Service dog. I was no confortable doing that... (I didn't want to impose or show up without a nitice) and the manager noticed I was going to check on my puppy few times and He said, if She is a Service dog..She was welcome to join us..

 They certainly got all my respect for such a touch of compassion ..She was very happy to seat near us and She did not even move at all...
Thank you for your attention and kindess Dear Manager.
author: Daniela L.

description:
I had high expectations for this restaurant and leaving with an expensive bill and disappointed was not my intention. 
We ordered the ceviche pescado which came with yuca chips that we got charged for without our consent. I'm ok with paying if the prices were disclosed. The ceviche was really salty and sour - completely over seasoned and the fish pieces were too big. I had to cut a piece in half to eat it. The grilled baby octopus was good but again overly salty. The short ribs were ok, overly salty yet again and not as tender as the other reviewers described. The fried mushrooms were probably the best of the bunch. The lomo saltado was ok, but the sauce was too salty. The fries could be better for a $23 dish.  Service was ok, but the staff could be more personable for these prices.  
I don't think we'll come back again, Vega and Red Hill Station are much better choices around these parts.
author: Peggy L.

description:
Piqueos was great!  The food was excellent, the service good, and the ambiance pleasant.

My friend and I shared the following dishes:

1) Complimentary chickpea corn starter - good
2) Peruvian-Chinese ceviche with a side of plantain chips - delicious!
3) Shrimp cake - tasty
4) Short ribs with mashed potatoes - amazing!
5) Spinach and cheese empanadas - unique and flavorful, in a fluffy, light pastry
5) Passion fruit panna cotta for dessert - delicious but rich

I also loved my glass of sangria!

The service was decent, though not particularly warm and friendly.  Also, they seemed over-eager to clear away dishes when we weren't quite finished with them, which was a bit irritating.

The setting is cozy and classy.

Overall a great spot - really spectacular food!
author: Barnali D.

description: Amazing Peruvian food. Everything was exquisite. Get the Sangria, baby octopus, shrimp, ceviche and Panna Cotta, you won't regret it!
author: Madelyn T.

description: Good little restaurant. Small plates better than entrees and the corn cake is perfection.
author: Dani G.

description: Amazing experience. Food was out of this world...(and I'm picky). Causa appetizer was delicious, yucca fries were crispy and tasty. Aji de gallina was so amazing..and I generally don't like chicken. And OMG lomo saltado.. perfectly seasoned. Topped it off with delightful alfajores and Panna Cotta. Perfect evening.
author: Diana C.

description: Ordered three tapas and a pitcher on sangria to share. One of the tapas I wasn't a fan of but the the other two tapas and sangria sure made up for it. The true star of the meal was the service staff. While the place is expensive, it is worth every penny. Well done Piqueo's.
author: K W.

description:
Ive been here many times and it has always been 3.5-4 star experience until last night. Let's start with bad stuff. Their sangria was offensive. Super sweet, it felt like I was drinking corn syrup. Paella was the worst I've ever had as far as I remember. No flavor, soggy and not much seafood. Really bad.
The good: short ribs and mac & cheese. Ceviche was OK.

All in all, they lost me as a customer, sorry...
author: Lo F.

description: We got the paella with squid ink and it was one of most interesting and delicious things I've had in a long time. Great flavor. If you like seafood ... this dish tasted like the ocean in all the best ways.
author: Roger S.

description:
Step into the smells of Peruvian food, on my take of this dinner with the wife the food was excellent, let me break down what we had, and how it faired

Found in the Dogpatch of San Francisco/ Bernal Heights this spot was easy to find but difficult to find parking, inside the restaurant it was close to pitch black with small candles at every table to slightly gather some light so you can read your menu and see your food, if you sat next to a window the light peering in helps, honestly I liked that it was dark.

Causa Tasting - chicken & baby octopus with chilled mashed potatoes, flavored with aji amarillo & lime juice, on this dish the chicken is shredded, baby octopus was seasoned and delicious the mashed potatoes was standard and buttery

Crab Cake Peruano - Dungeness crab, sweet rocoto sauce, berros & Oaxaca cheese. One mid sized crab cake, order two, this is one of the items you don't want to share, difficult to describe not like your average crab cake definitely different is all I can say

Pulpito Bebe - Baby octopus, papitas dorada & ocopa. chewy but flavorful slightly vinegary I think I liked the Causa Tasting better then dish, there was more ummph in the Causa

Lomo Saltado - stir fried beef tenderloin, onions, tomatoes, cilantro & soy sauce served with fries and rice, had this dish at several other restaurants sadly this place it was not the best I had more of the passing grade, fries did not have that piping hot crunch in the bite, the beef was tender for me it was sliced to small, a tad to salty for me, mind you I know there is soy sauce with the sauce but it seemed a tad overkill on the meat, onions and tomatoes were standard, set it up this way and the saltiness will cease, grab a helpful scoop of rice, on top of the rice add the onions tomatoes, throw the beef tenderloin on it then get 3 tbps of that soy sauce and throw some fries on top

Seco De Cordero - their version of braised lamb shank, it was good, not my favorite dish but it was good, tender, not too salty, meat portion wise was good for me I think I was looking for a more heartier sauce accompaniment. 

definitely recommend this place for first date, second date, anniversary, etc 

food ****
price $$$
service *****
ambiance **** very dark but I prefer the dark
author: Clarence A.

description: Delicious, delicious food in a warm and charming atmosphere. Fun wine list as well. I ordered the tuna starter, and the shrimp and the scallop tapas. Fresh and unique flavors. Service was just okay -- this the 4 versus 5 stars.
author: Annmarie N.

description:
Late review. I went to Piqueos earlier this year, maybe sometime around April/May. Hopefully the food has changed since then, since I can see good reviews.

Making this review on their Lomo Saltado/Lomito al Jugo solely. I remember ordering this dish and asking if it was possible to do this with chicken, which they so kindly said they could do. Unfortunately, I regret to say, this was possibly one of the worst peruvian dishes I've had. I felt that the sauce/soup was easily a campbells tomato soup poured onto the food. The fries felt like they were store bought from the frozen aisle--in all, the dish was terrible.

I feel I'm being extremely critical as I come from LA and had excellent peruvian cuisine from many restaurants. I've also had the pleasure to go to very good peruvian restaurants in SF, that I must've paid the same amount for, without the "terrible" in it. While I hate to compare restaurants, I feel you should skip on Piqueos and go to Fresca and/or even Limon. It'll taste much better for possibly the same price. Maybe I'll try again some other time.
author: William Á.

description:
This place is very memorable to me because it is one of the first places my boyfriend took me when we were still dating.  A hidden gem of a neighborhood restaurant in Bernal Heights with delightful Peruvian Food.

Get the piqueos or appetizers which is what they are known for and share it with the table:
~Ceviche Mixto - mix of seafood marinated in lime juice/aji limo and rocoto, served with yam/Peruvian corn and cancha an interesting play of flavors that I enjoyed, a must try!
~Tuna Tartar - I couldn't get enough of this served with plantain chips! 
~Tequenos -Shrimp-mozzarella stuffed wontons with chicha morada sauce was simple but flavorful.
~Crab Cake Peruano - potato chips crusted fresh Dungeness crab cake served with Sweet aji rocoto sauce another favorite..who doesn't love crab cakes. 
~Beef Empanada - crusty and flaky crust with perfectly spiced filling.

Also notable entrees and the other reason why I adore Piqueos:
~Pechuga de Pato  - Roasted duck breast was tender, moist, simple & enchanting.

~Seco de Cordero - leg of lamb slow braised in cilantro-peruvian dark beer sauce with white beans, everything about this dish is heaven in my mouth and one of the reasons I love my boyfriend for taking me here. The lamb just fell of the bone melt in your mouth good!

Lastly you have to get the Chocolate Lava cake to top off this meal order it ahead since it takes 20 minutes to prepare.

Piqueos is consistently warm, friendly, not rushed, homey, and the food is delicious. The menu is very consistent, and we have not had a dish we didn't like yet. For a last minute treat, or a cozy meal, or if you need an infusion of true comfort food...eat here! 5 SOLID STARS!
author: Maria M.

description: Amazing food and service. It has a twist to Peruvian food, but compliments the food very well. Only thing the space is kind of small.
author: Bob B.

description: Love this place. It's a gem in a neighborhood :) Almost don't want to post a good review so it doesn't get too popular and we can't get a table on Friday nights anymore ;)
author: Julia M.

description: My boyfriend picked out this lovely restaurant for my birthday dinner. Luckily we were able to place a reservation that same evening. Our table was fairly small, but it wasn't a big issue. The server here was friendly, and kept a good eye on us without being too intrusive. They started us with w/ complimentary deep fried garbanzo beans which were surprisingly good! Our yuca fries and baby octopus appetizer then came. Both were cooked nicely, and the octopus had a nice chargrilled flavor to it. We also had the ceviche mixto which had a variety of seafood (mussels, clams, shrimp, fish, etc.) and the sauce was perfect, and seafood was fresh. For our entrees, we had the lomo saltado & paella. Both were delicious, we was everything else we had. The paella is the more saucy, yellow saffron kind, rather than the dryer more orange type that I think is more common. I usually like the drier, orange kind but the one here was pretty good, and I loved that they gave a lot of seafood unlike other restaurants that give a lot more rice. I was so fill after the paella, I only took three bites of the lomo saltado. Of course we had to finish wth dessert. My boyfriend surprised me with the passion fruit panna cotta, which he snuck away and told our server that it was my birthday & they brought it out topped with a candle. It was sooo delicious & and plated beautifully. Oh, and the sangria was delicious! Our server also offered us a complimentary glass of wine after he accidentally poured an extra glass, which was sweet. Would definitely recommend Piqueo's for quality Peruvian dishes for a cute date or semi formal dinner.
author: Elise T.

description: WOW...just WOW! everything was fantastic. Got taken here for a birthday dinner and everything was simply amazing. The mood was set, the staff was pleasant and the food was fantastic. No better way to celebrate a birthday. My favorite had to be the empanada and the Peruvian beer. White this place is really pricey, it is a good way to treat yourself on a special occasion.
author: Andrew M.

description:
One of the most emblematic food in the area! I was having a Dinner with my girlfriend last night. First the restaurant is a nice cozy place to have a moment  for enjoy the night, perfect latin music. So about the atmosphere 5 Gold stars. I Ordered to start a Ceviche China nice an fresh tuna, with different types of corn, yummy! perfect to initiate the tasting. We share the food with a Bottle of white wine "Tempranillo" over the section of wines.
 
For the main course I decided to enjoy the lomo saltado the most emblematic peruvian dish, a mix of salted onions, tomatoes, scallion, serve with rice, just fantastic and my Girlfriend she enjoyed the Salmon with quinoa, a piece of salmon over quinoa light tasty, juicy. Definitely we had a wonderful dinner. After all this courses and food we ordered two desert, "alfajores" and "Suspiro a la limeña" the last it was my favorite! 

To finish the whole staff was nice, humble, well known people about the menu  and passionate about their own food. They brought the best energy, with charismatic latin attitude.
author: Daniel P.

description: We had a large party and they placed us in a back room. The room was perfect, because we were the only group there. Food was prompt. Sangrias were perfect. Prices seemed reasonable. We'll definitely go back.
author: Michael C.

description:
From the start to the finish what a outstanding meal and service.  Extremely friendly.  The flavors that were on the dishes we had were outstanding!  We went with a group of 5 and shared ceviche with tuna and white fish and a fried wanton with shrimp inside fan feeler tastic!  
For main dishes we had paella traditional, pork adobo, beef tips and the braised lamb shoulder.  How amazing were all these meals we all fought our forks to decide who ate what. 
The biggest way I rate a place is if I would come back... And the answer is without a doubt with my whole party!  I don't know if I can say enough nice things about this meal but if you have any other adjectives to describe perfection let me know!!!
author: Alex G.

description: So delicious! What a great little spot. We found this place on yelp and was close enough to our neighborhood. I'd recommend the chicharron de pollo and the paella!! You much get the paella if they have it. Also don't skip dessert.
author: Candace C.

description: Since my last review everything has changed. Piqueos is under new management & the customer service has greatly improved. Food is still amazing!
author: Keady P.

description: Everything was awesome. Panna cotta at the end with crunchy textured grains was amazing
author: Hyun B.

description:
Some of the best Peruvian food I've ever had in my life! Yummy fried chick peas when you are seated.
Delicious empanadas and Mac and cheese. Definitely planning on going back soon.
author: Marisa K.

description:
This place is amazing! This is my first time here. It's a bit small but it feels warm and cozy. The atmosphere is friendly and great music.  The staff is very friendly. My best friend and I were looking for a place to get a couple of drinks and appetizers on a Saturday night and we ran I to this place. 

Outside there was a sign that said they closed at 8:30, it was 7:55 so we thought we weren't going to be able to get seated. The nice lady at the front told us to come right in ad we were quickly seated. With no rush at all, our waiter was nice and told us to take our time. We ordered sangria for drinks and we ordered chicharones de pollo with a delicious dipping sauce and the shrimps with yams. Not only did our plates look pretty but they were both delicious! Then we ordered the passion fruit pans cotta which was also great! It's a great portion and can feed 2-3 ppl. The prices here are not bad at all for the portions served. 
My experience here was great and I can't wait to  come back again and this time I will be on time so I can enjoy more of this  place!  Thank you for your awesome service!
author: Stacy G.

description:
We came here after making advance reservations for a dinner on Saturday night. Parking is on the streets and luckily we found one within a couple of blocks. We were seated within a few minutes after we arrived.

The complimentary chick peas tasted great. After looking through the menu, we ordered Fried Plantains for appetizers and Lamb Shank and Pork Shoulder for entree. The friend plantain was neatly displayed with raspberry sauce swirled on top of the plantain and on the side. Yummy! Both the entrees turned out to be awesome; I must say that I liked the lamb better though. 

We ordered the Peruvian dulce de leche from the dessert menu. Whatever it was, never tasted anything like that before and it was absolutely mouth-watering.

Service is brisk and fast; overall a nice dining experience. I am not a big fan of their cramped ambiance. Too many people around and very less space to walk around.
author: Anu M.

description: The place is extremely cold. The people wear gloves and coats inside of the restaurant. The plates are very very small, you should take several starters, otherwise the main plates will be like a start.
author: Jess G.

description:
Piqueo's is small restaurant atop the Protero Hill district on Cortland street that is transforming from a low end hood for the projects into a more gentrified destination for the up and coming. 

It is another gem in the crown jewels of Executive Chef Carlos Altamirano, who has 3 other restaurant properties and will soon be opening another one in Walnut Creek. They are all different with different focus and names, but all leverage the Peruvian heritage embodied in Chef Altamirano. 

Piqueo's, although small and modest has a hostess on staff (at least on weekends) with mostly tables for 2 and 4. The food is inventive and fabulous, with a fusion of flavors that is becoming well known in nuevo-Peruvian cooking, perhaps popularized by the internationally known celebrity chef at Astrid y Gaston, Gaston Acurio. 

The menu has a range of choices, with starters, tapas or small plates (about a dozen) and about 10 entrees as well. 

The mix of Chinese, Japanese, Italian and Peruvian flavors is indicative of this new Peruvian cuisine, and we were very happy with our 6 choices, mostly tapas. Most of the small plates are in the $12 range, and the entrees in the $20 range. 

There is a decent wine selection to choose from, although it is mostly bottle or glass sized, with good choices from Argentina and Chile. We went with a nice Pinot Noir from Chile to accompany our mix of meat and seafood tapas. 

See mouth watering pics for individual dishes. 

This place is a nice little gem and I would love to come back and try some more.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
I have been eating at Piqueo's for years, since it opened on Cortland. I use to love this nook of a restaurant! It was a special place my mom and I would have empanadas (we shared cheese & spinach as well as the beef) and coffee after a mani/pedi at Bernal Nail Salon. It was also a place my bff and I often met at for wine & tapas, where my family and I took out of towners and the last restaurant my father dined at before his sudden passing in 2013. Thus, this restaurant has held a special place in my heart and belly. But not after today! My mom and I had our usual mani/pedi and decided to go for coffee and empanadas afterwards. We were told that we had to wait an hour for a table when there were plenty of empty tables. The hostess was nice, but our server, this short Latino guy, said that there was a large group coming in an hour, so we could be seated right away, but we had to be done in one hour. I was ready to leave, but my mom wanted to stay. While we were eating my mom shared that she felt looked down to by the waiter/short, Latino dude and she felt like maybe it was because we were in casual clothing and flip-flops. The FOOD: we had the yucca balls, the shrimp over sweet potato mash and the cheese & spinach empanadas. They were all just blah. I feel like the taste had definitely decreased in flavor and quality. I was very surprised to learn the chef is the same. Even the sauces, which are Peruvian specialties, we're not add good add they usually are. The prices have also gone up. The empanadas were $13 each. All four items were a total of $60 after taxes, without tip. 

One hour time limit
+
Making my enthusiastic mom feel bad
+
Your food not tasting that good anymore
+
Expensive/Not getting your money's worth
=
Not Going Back 

PS: the wait staff kept bumping into my chair!
author: Claudia R.

description: The food was good but I wouldn't go back to eat here. To begin with , the hostess was extremely rude upon our arrival. None of the wait staff are friendly or helpful and they don't make you feel at all welcomed.  The people need to take lessons in customer service if they plan to stay in business. When I spend money going out to eat I fully expect good customer service. Even if I like the food I won't return to a restaurant if I feel the customer service doesn't appreciate my hard earned money. There are plenty other restaurants in the city that you can go to that will give you good service.
author: Susan W.

description:
I dare you to read my description of my latest feast at Piqueos and not get turned on. I know I did. 

- Bolitas de Yucca: Crispy yucca balls stuffed with Ham & cheese. Served with
andouille sausage sauce.

- Mac N' Cheese with bacon, mixed cheeses and huancaina sauce.

- Atun (Weekends only): a generous portioned ahi tuna steak, polenta and a sweet roasted plantain. 

I'll give you a minute to compose yourself.
author: Alex L.

description:
One of the best dining experiences I've had in a long time. The boy and I went for date night after making reservation the same day. We told them on Open Table about my Celiac Disease and that we would need to be sure that they could accommodate a safe dinning experience. We felt comfortable with our dining choice because of all of the good Yelp reviews about having many gluten free options. Well they sure lived up to it.

We arrived to find a gluten free menu already set at the table for us, and the waiter was extremely knowledgable and helpful about my options. We ordered 4 small plate options, and every dish was better than the last. We had the chicken avocado dish, the sweet corn with shrimp, the crab cake (yes a gluten free crab cake), and the scallops. Even though we ordered all of them at once, they were perfectly timed so that the dishes didn't overlap, and we were able to enjoy each one individually (one of my big pet peeves when ordering small plates is when you have 4 plates sitting at your table all at once and you don't get adequate time to enjoy one dish without the others getting cold). The waiters were attentive, filling water glasses often and offering new plates if old ones were covered in amazing sauce from the previous dish. 

Every dish was perfectly cooked, so full of flavor and we basically licked the plate clean every time. While every dish was so amazing, I must say that the crab cake was so unique and delicious. I also haven't been able to eat a crab cake in 6 years, so deprivation might have had something to do with it. I would absolutely recommend this place for dinner dates. Make a reservation, and take your time... it's worth it!!!
author: Laura K.

description:
Of the 10+ dishes we tried, the complimentary fried garbanzo beans with white corn, hominy, diced onion & tomatoes was the standout. Reveals quite a bit about the rest of the meal, but at least it started out right. 

Notes: 
-- scallops were beautifully seared & browned, but did not pair well with bed of mashed sweet potato 
-- pulled pork sandwich had a fair amount of tang & seasoning  
-- quinoa shrimp: I had high hopes for it. Nice crunch, but shrimp itself was not properly seasoned 
-- lomo saltado: cubes of beef were tender & salted perfectly. Sauce was nothing more than soy sauce. I like my white rice more sticky. 
-- dulce de leche tasted of too much alcohol. The little boy actually made a sour face & asked, "WHY does it taste like that?"
-- passionfruit juice=I'm a very happy diner 
-- so many other dishes that I either did not try or did not enjoy (ceviche, salmon, short ribs, etc.,) 

Total:~$185 (not including tip) for 6 people 

Though food is three stars, I'd give the overall experience four stars -- Decent-size tapas that were brought out a few plates at a time, efficient service, attractive, modern ambiance, & you can't beat the neighborhood (we're very familiar with bernal heights...sparks such nostalgia!) The fam bam enjoyed themselves, but I wouldn't rush to eat here again.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Do not come here. 

The food was delicious. I ordered the chicken and it was fantastic, although a little dry. However, service was extremely slow from beginning to end. Late to take our order, late to bring the food out, and slow to bring us the check even after we asked. Only come here if you're not that hungry, have a lot of time to kill, and don't run out of conversation with your companions.

Edit: Turns out, they brought us the wrong check the first time. Then we got the correct check, but they had overcharged us. Lowering to one star. Don't come here.
author: Ariana C.

description:
Came here today expecting delicious food based on prior reviews. Was not disappointed! The beef tenderloin was moist and flavorful, the dishes were expertly arranged, and the sangria was incredibly fruity. 

However, it felt like we were invisible, or that we had somehow wronged the waitstaff. Any request took upwards of 15 minutes to fulfill, and we waited almost an hour for our food. The restaurant was almost empty when we walked in and they didn't seem to be overly short on staff, so I wonder what they were doing (or what we did) to receive such slow service. For the hefty price, it wasn't worth the wait. 

Once we got the check, it was for the completely wrong table. You guessed it - took another 10 minutes to get the correct check. 

I don't think I'd come back again unless I needed to kill a few hours for some reason. I really hate to be one of those typical glass-half-empty Yelp reviewers, but we had such a poor experience that I think it's justified.
author: Derek R.

description:
Absolutely lovely! 

Pros: super unique Peruvian fusion cuisine that is packed with flavor. The crab cake with cheese = BOMB! And so were the scallops with blue potato puree. Ceviche had a hefty portion with tangy and spicy sauce that I just could not stop sipping on

Cons: so dark, small space, hostess wasn't the friendliest... she did not wanna be there.

Tip: call ahead to reserve, I would skip the paella as it's nothing better. I would also skip the steak as it was just mediocre. Stick to the tapas! And get a bottle of red wine =D

Will be back for the lava chocolate cake that takes 15 minutes to make so order ahead of time!
author: Christal T.

description:
Love the food, love the service! 

Lamb Shank: 
AMAZING. The meat just falls off the bones. Super moist, juicy, and tender. Mmm, I can just taste it... The Panamito beans just made the perfect combo. And the onions?? Omg, the limey/lemon-ey taste definitely made a difference. I've never been so eager to dive my fork into raw onions before. Needless to say, it was heavenly.

Macaroni and Cheese:
 So, so good. I love my food burning hot, so this was the perfect starter. The sausages mixed in it also made it a bit different. I also loved the crunchy Panko ! Mm... Crunchy Mac and cheese. 

The other dishes we ordered were okay (pork ribs & beef tenderloin). 

I'll definitely be back for the Lamb Shank and Macaroni & Cheese!
author: Joyce G.

description:
This restaurant is a must-try! I've had Peruvian food before but nothing as good as this! Every dish including dessert was plated beautifully and cooked to perfection. My favorite was the Yucca dish.. Amazingness! 
I must also say that for as packed as the restaurant was when I was there the service was phenomenal even with one server. I recommend this place to anyone who loves a great atmosphere with an elevated Latin flare!
author: Tobias T.

description: Surprisingly good. A little expensive for what it was....but I guess not so much so by SF standards.
author: David M.

description: Wow, what a great restaurant. Love coming to this restaurant when I'm in town. The food is amazing and the service is phenomenal. All the staff make you feel like family. I recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family. Well worth the price. The staff is always open to give suggestions. This restaurant has never disappointed. Make sure and stop by this cute joint.
author: Garrett M.

description:
My second trip to Piqueo's was amazing and deserves more stars. What is that 10 stars now? ;) My new boss treated me and another friend to dinner one night and I picked the restaurant. They even let me order for the group. Just another perk of being incredibly into food. I ordered the:

*Ceviche Mixto: Again, a Piqueo favorite of mine and worth the money. Red snapper, mussels & clams, shrimp, red onions, cilantro & aji rocoto leche de tigre: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=HfFaz9OWGjA3Ljox19HWwQ
*Crab Cake Peruano: potato chip crusted fresh Dungeness crab cake served with sweet aji rocoto sauce and really really good. Glad we tried this dish. 
*Lomo Saltado, one of the most perfect steak dishes I have had lately. Very tender and juicy. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=fRarTyMkIQwSUPvlxcn2pg served with rice. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=rXUxP-O36f4ObgXymUMO7w
*Pulled Pork Sliders (Sliced for sharing): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=8rEHz8zJ8DfcR3HKp33uUA

And I'm pretty sure we ordered those scallops again, although I forgot a pic this time, here is what it looks like from last time, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=B9LhaFNc3ifmt5TYcxJonA

I love booking a table on Open Table and never having to wait. Good food when you want it and worth every penny.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Love this Peruvian spot! Food is amazing. The appetizer they served us was so good. It was a fried chickpea salad. Service was great. We ordered the tuna tartare, seared scallops, churrasco, and molten chocolate cake for dessert ( took about 15 mins to make) . I got tipsy after half a glass of sangria. I would recommend every single dish we ordered. But the seared scallops with mashed potatoes is money ! 

Also head over to holy water for a drink after !
author: Jennie C.

description:
So piqueo's is apparently the sister restaurant of Mochica which I happened to try awhile back...same owners but huge difference all around. 

Although the ambiance and parking were about the same...the food and service, on the other hand, were like night and day.  We had set up a reservation on opentable and had our groupon ready...as soon as we walked in, our table was ready immediately.  

We were greeted with a couple of glasses of water and a small bowl of addicting fried chick peas.  The server recommended an excellent glass of wine for me while wifey had a glass of chimamosa.  Both were delish.  

We started off with the cebiche mixto...this appetizer was super tasty, fresh, and fun for my palate.  I loved the chunks of fish and the variety of seafood...and they weren't stingy.  Much better than Mochica if you ask me...

For our main dishes we ordered the adobo with sweet potato mash and the paella classica.  The adobo was surprisingly delish...I couldn't get enough of the sauce and the sweet potato mash complimented the meat perfectly.  Oh btw, the meat was absolutely tender and falling apart on your fork delicious.  The paella killed the one I had at mochica's...the seafood was plentiful.  The rice was cooked perfectly.  The seasoning was just right.  

Our server was slammed but he still paced our meal well...no complaints there.  We skipped out on dessert though cause Mitchell's was calling out names...haha.  But next time I return, I will definitely try the dessert.  

5 solid stars...loved our experience there...will return again!
author: Jen W.

description: This place was so great that my fiance and I went two nights in a row! Everything we had was incredible. The sauces are amazing. Loved everything!
author: Emily S.

description: This is by far the best Peruvian restaurant I've ever eaten at.  The food and service were outstanding.  The ambience was delightful ( I sat near an open window looking out onto the Bernal Heights section of the city).  Everything we ordered was exceptional from the Cebiche Mixto (ceviche composed of fish and shellfish) to the scallops appetizer to the baked corn starter (humita dulce).  The entrees that we chose were baked ahi (tuna), seafood paella and roast pork in sauce (sanguchon).  All were superb.   The wine list is modest but appropriate.  Youu can find the menu at http://piqueossf.com/menu
author: Bob S.

description:
Piqueo's is the Peruvian sister restaurant to Mochica in SOMA and the 1-Michelin starred La Costanera in Montara Beach (half-way between Pacifica & Half Moon Bay). 

They start you off with an amuse / app of fried garbanzos, onions, and corn (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=zwjJOm3F7oT62Q2vFrDqVQ). Tasty start to the meal. They tried (and failed) to clear our unfinished bowl of this when the cebiche came out ;-)

Cebiche - more irregular sized cuts of fish compared to La Costanera's version (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=3W7QU7eanoWETzJEUlB5ow). Lightly spicy with a nice mix of flavors from the leche de tigre. A couple of stringy membranes showed some sloppy knife-work.

Scallops, salsa panchita (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=EojlhH9szMeQC9Lx3bEKrQ). Based on our instructions of "no cilantro in anything", they subbed out the cilantro mashed potatoes for plain. The scallops were nicely seared and seasoned. My favorite of the night.

Tequeños are like a Crab Rangoon with shrimp instead of crab. The diced shrimp & mozzarella are fried in wonton wrappers and come with some guacamole and a sweet purple corn (chicha morada) sauce with a sprinkle of powdered sugar on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=0vsepYPRwNE_5Rr76Je4mg). This was tasty, but much more cheesy than shrimpy.

Beef Empanada was odd. Instead of the typically formed pastry around the filling in a half-moon shape that you can see in other pictures, this was  rectangular puff pastry simply folded in half over a triangular mix of the filling in the center part (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=qTqHOYuF1XqSC6I3MVdTdQ). The outer triangles had nothing but nicely cooked puff pastry and the inner section with the filling had undercooked puff pastry trying to hide under the dusting of sugar. The meat was tender in a very sweet sauce (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vsiJDU-0_cdYrf1Otawtbw?select=te8s6RGpM9-ESHRbMLUu3g). I picked the meat out of the unappetizing pastry shell.

Cebiche: 3.5 stars
Scallops: 4.5 stars
Tequeños: 3.5 stars
Empanada: 2 stars

Overall: 3.5 stars. Rounding up for the excellent service.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I'm so happy I discovered this amazing place ! Excellent food and amazing service ! A must go place !
We were craving Peruvian food on a Saturday night, we looked for the nearest place in the area and Piqueos was the one with better reviews, unfortunately nothing was open in our desire time, but we went there anyways to hope  for a cancellation or bar seating. We got there and my first impression was .... Wowww ... The ambiance of this place was great, full house  ( must be good!! ) Great music and an open kitchen... We got greeted right away By hostess who was very cordial and friendly, we couldn't  get a table because there was a limit time since everything was reserved, so we went for the bar ( unlimited time ) ... We were impressed with the talent of the chefs... Speedy cooking. Once helped by the waiter, who was very nice and professional, food came out in proper time... Wine was great... Dessert was good, we got the tiramisu special. Everyone is so friendly there that you feel welcomed and appreciated. 
I will definitely come back , and will bring more friends !
author: Haydee R.

description:
I had never been here before tonight and went with a group of five for dinner. The food was great. The server was great. We were all about it. We paid the check and we were finishing the wine and that's when it happened. The hostess came to our table, asked us to "finish up because we have to turn this table for other people waiting." What? we had been there about an hour and a half, nothing crazy for apps dinner and drinks. Two people at our table had half full glasses of wine. I was thinking surely she did not say that. But we all kind of looked at each other and made our way to the door. I couldn't help but ask her if she had indeed asked us to get up and leave because she was ready to sit someone else. She not only confirmed that she said that, but also waived the menu at other people and rolled her eyes. 

Too bad this place had this person working. She did not ruin the overall experience, but I won't be back. As I told her, I have never been told to leave to make room and I assured her I would never be back. And I won't. If I owned this place she would not be returning either.
author: Shane M.

description:
Had dinner here on a Friday night with my husband, and another couple.

We made a reservation, and when we got there our friends had just been seated.

I was surprised/disappointed that they have no beer on tap. So, if you're trying a new one, no tasting, just full commitment.

I had the scallop appetizer, and it was the best thing I had that night. The scallops were cooked and seasoned perfectly, which seems to happen so rarely. The purple mash that came with them was similar to something i make at home, but it was good. I only wish the red onion hadn't been so mixed in. I hate red onion, and the restaurant is somewhat dimly lit, making it hard to pick it out.

For entrees we shared: the Lomo Saltado, and the Aji de Gallina (on the server's rec.)
Both were underwhelming. The steak in the lomo saltado was mushy, and it had more chunks of unripe tomatoes than anything else. 
Ugh, please restaurants stop serving tomatoes out of season, they're so unappetizing! The dish tasted like soy sauce, and not much else.

The Aji de Gallina was the better of the two, but still a bit bland.

I did appreciate that as soon as my friend told them she had celiac, they brought her a menu with the gluten free items highlighted.

While nothing was bad, nothing was very impressive. I had been looking forward to trying this place for awhile, and left disappointed.
author: Amanda G.

description: Nice enough place, but don't take too long to eat... Otherwise they will just come up to you and say, "We have other people coming, we need the table." So you, uhm, have to finish your drink quickly. And they were rather rude about it too.
author: David D M.

description:
I have lived in San Francisco for over 15 years. One of the things we love about our city is the variety of nice restaurants. We go out to dinner 2 -3 times a week. I normally don't take the time to write a review. But after our experience last evening, I felt the need to do this. 

We had been to Piqueos for a friend's birthday a while back. Our experience was really good so I decided to try it again for a group of 5 of us. We made a 7:00PM reservation last evening, a Friday. We arrived on time and were seated around 7:10. 

The food, as with our previous experience was quite good. We all had wine with some excellent appetizers, main courses and dessert. The check came, we provided our credit cards, signed the bill and were wrapping things up. 

As the waiter picked up our final signed bill and thanked us, the hostess appeared. She abruptly said: "You have to leave now... I have people waiting for this table." Note this was at 8:40, exactly 1  1/2 hours after being seated... Her tone was very cold and very rude.   We were all in shock. 

As we left the restaurant, I commented to her that I had never experienced such treatment in a San Francisco restaurant and that I would not be return. She looked up at me and in a dismissive tone of voice said: "Sorry!" Her actions totally ruined a nice evening for all of us.

What was even more interesting is that as we walked out, we noticed that there was no one standing waiting for a table!

I will never return to Piqueos and would never recommend going.
author: john r.

description: Awesome food and drinks - great tapas and sangria! We came here with friends visiting San Francisco. All of us enjoyed the food, atmosphere and the drinks. BUT they only let you sit for an hour and tell you to leave once your time is up! Doesn't make any sense
author: Merve A.

description:
We came here with friends in saturday before going dancing.
This place is very tasty. 
That my first time with peruvian food and i love it.
We share a lot of house specialities and every plate were amazing.
The lamb ( eat onion and meet together for an explosion of taste) and the beef are amazing.
author: Thomas M.

description: I am giving 3 stars to Piqueo's ONLY because the  SERVICE was spotty and it is unfortunate that it takes one person to ruin an great food experience. My male server was temperamental, rude and absent. Fortunately there were more people helping that were attentive and  had the customer service skills of a reputable restaurant. The food at Piqueos is excellent. We tried the ceviche, seared scallops, spinach empanada, mushrooms and chicharron de pollo and everything was delicious and fresh. I would recommend Piqueo's for the food, hopefully, you wont encounter a waiter with a bad attitude that would put a bad taste to your dining experience.
author: Tonia V.

description: The food was tasty. The service was excellent. Even though the restaurant was small they mangled to make it a pleasant place to enjoy the meal. However, I believe they should advertise their restaurant as a fusion Peruvian. They don't have a single plate that even remotely resembles the traditional Peruvian food. I also believe they should not use the name of the traditional plates. The pan con chicharron was a bbq pulled pork sandwich. They don't do any favors to the plates they claim to serve at their restaurants. Instead they hurt the plate's reputation. I would however recommend the chicha morada.
author: Carlos T.

description: Lame.  Food wasnt bad but not great.  First off, they didnt serve us the fried garbonzos before we order until our order arrived.  Oh and no water or even offer of water upon sitting and even after we ordered wine. Staff was eh...not so enthusiastic to be there.  Prob a family business and there out of obligation.  It was felt. Two of the waitresses kept repeating their questions to us as one left and the other returned.  It was confusing.  Then we order the fried yuca.  Middle was cold so we sent it back.  They did apologize but then when we asked for hot sauce to eat with it, they charged us $1.  Why bother but toally sent us the wrong msg!   Anyways, all that to say this place is not worth the effort or money given location and all of above.  Just go to Fresca's about 2miles away.
author: Jez S.

description: Delicious food! We ordered and shared a bunch of small plates. I would definitely recommend the shrimp cake and spinach and cheese empanada. Great spot and good service.
author: Cora M.

description:
Holy f*ckballs this place is SCREEEEEEAMIN'!!! I just ate here last night and as I'm writing this, I'm salivating at the recollection of my meal. My husband's meal too. This is the brick and mortar version of the food truck Sanguchon. Really delicious Peruvian goodness ooze from the building as well as the truck. I feel like this is one of the shining stars of Bernal. I'm so happy I live close! 

My husband had the lomito la jugo. I had the negra paella. We shared the cebiche mixto and the yucca fries. The negra paella is OTHERWORLDLY. It's paella but the sauce is squid ink. It's truly last meal worthy. The service is prompt and friendly, and the setting is intimate and romantic. 

Do yourself a favor and eat here. Unless you hate delicious foods. I will DEFINITELY be frequenting this place so much more than I have been.
author: Kaliah C.

description:
The WORST service I have ever had in 10 years of eating out at least 3 times a week in San Francisco!

I don't think telling your customers with reservations that their table is taken by others who did not make reservations is the type of treatment San Franciscans will appreciate!  Especially while you are telling them that other empty tables are held for other reservations!  Am I not a customer good enough for your precious restaurant?.....  Then the general service is so bad that we had to ask for refills and put up with having to use same silverware all through out dinner.  Please value your customers more; they will appreciate it.
PLEASE understand that your customers are NOT to be yelled at no matter how good you think your food is.


The WORST TREATMENT I HAVE EVER HAD.  IF IT HAD NOT BEEN A CELEBRATION DINNER FOR MY CLOSEST FRIEND WHO WANTED TO TRY THE PLACE WE CERTAINLY WOULD HAVE WALKED OUT THE FIRST MINUTE.

All gimmick and attitude that reflects over blown prices and poor service -- save yourself the frustration,
author: Serdar Y.

description:
Unfortunately we didn't have a good experience last Saturday. First, I made a reservation for 10 people to celebrate my wife's birthday, and I was asked to provide with my credit card info so they will charge me $150 dollars if we don't show up, I asked what if not all shows up? and they told me that it should be ok as long as 6 or 7 be present. This is the first time I made a reservation with such requirement but I accepted because I wanted to have a good time with family in a nice place and great food, I have to say that the food there is delicious! we definitely like the food.
Parking is not easy to find as many places in the city, but I was lucky to find one spot in less than 10 minutes two blocks away.
Now when we showed up to the restaurant, they took us to the back of the restaurant and our table was ready, the room was warm as they had heaters turned on in there.
The servers hardly smiled and be courteous to us, they need to work hard on this, as for me customer service is huge in this type of business, even better than great food ... I come back to a restaurant where the food is ok but the service is excellent.
After a few minutes we were only 5 people and I told the receptionist that the other persons won't come and we can move around to free up one of the tables, I apologized for the inconvenience. She came back saying that the manager was upset and they will still charge me on my credit card because they were losing money, so I was thinking if the manager was planning to charge me $150 dollars over whatever we consume during the dinner or what? Again, I had never been in this situation. So we apologize again and told her that I can't force people to show up, unfortunately is not under my control,  and she went back with the manager and then told us that everything is Ok and they started to moves the tables. Then we got a text from a couple we invited saying that they were late and looking for parking.
Everybody had the same impression, I haven't experience this bad service in a long time and I 'm not planning to come back again, sad because we like the food,
author: Pedro N.

description: We ordered ají de gallina, ceviche mixto, and lomo saltado. All were tasty and nicely presented. However, I'm giving them 3 stars because servers kept coming to take our plates away when we were not done yet. Needs better customer service.
author: Beatriz F.

description:
This place was wonderful! 

We had really early reservations at 5:30 pm so I think we were the only customers in the restaurant upon arrival.  I'm glad we made our reservations early because by the time we left, the restaurant was filled up! 

We ordered almost every single thing on the menu and I'm so glad we did.  We were stuffed and all was amazing.  

We had the following items: 

Diced ahi tuna/marinated in oriental sauce, served 
with plantain chips & avocado puree

Tequeños
Shrimp-mozzarella stuffed wontons with chicha morada sauce
and Avocado Mousse

Empanadas 
Beef and cheese

Short Ribs Braised in red wine - tomatoe sauce with potato and carrots

Camarones al Ajo Sauteed tiger shrimp with garlic sauce & soffrito

Clasico Paella 
Arborio rice cooked in saffron-tomato sauce with
Prawns, red snapper, mussels, clams & halibut

fried plantains

All was delicious!  We will definitely return.  Highly recommend and love the service.  Parking wasn't too bad either. My girlfirends and I had a great time. Thank you for the memorable dinner Piqueos!
author: Christine P.

description:
Really really tempted to give 5 stars.. while all foods were fantastic, not sure if this is standard-setting, a place I'd recommend as a MUST-TRY in SF. 

Anyway, I stopped by dinner here for a friend in town and even though I'd already eaten, I was coerced into trying each dish they got. I'm glad for it.. they were all delicious.

* Crab Cake Peruano $16 - 4.5 stars
(potato chips crusted fresh Dungeness crab cake served with Sweet aji rocoto sauce)
Crab - so fresh. Breading - so perfect, light, nice crunch. Sauce - delectable. 

* Short Ribs (Stew) $12 - 4.5 stars
(Braised in red wine - tomatoe sauce with potato and carrots)
The sauce, mixed w/ buttery mashed potatoes, was super tangy and tasty. The beef was incredibly soft and tender. Really delicious.

* Papa Rellena (Fried) $11 - 4 stars
(Yellow potato ball stuffed with beef picadillo)
Another fantastic dish. The breading is just as perfect as the crab cake. The only reason it's a notch down in ratings is the flavors aren't as well balanced, as it is mostly potato. But damn good potato.

* Paella Clasico $22 - 5 stars
(Arborio rice cooked in saffron-tomato sauce with Prawns, red snapper, mussels, clams & halibut)
Really, really, really delicious. The sauce was so fresh and full of flavor. Everything was just balanced perfectly, and whatever piece of fish I had (halibut?) was fantastic, perfect texture. Just a beautifully made dish.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Such a great restaurant all the way around.  Our server was fantastic, had a great sense of humor and started our night off on the right foot.  I'm pretty sure we ordered almost everything on the menu.  Some of my highlights included any of the cebiches and the grilled pork sparerib was outstanding.

Nice little spot in Bernal with excellent service and even better food.
author: Blake B.

description:
Came here with a friend on Friday at 8:00pm.  The restaurant was packed.  Be sure to make reservation and allow extra times to look for street parking.  Finding street parking maybe tough at night.
 
The decor of the restaurant is very cozy and homey feel.  The staffs are all friendly and sweet.  One thing to complain is the table is very close to each other...but that is ok because the food here is making that up.

The menu has a variety of selection.  The menu always changes.  We ordered five small plates.  The portion was pretty big compared to other tapas places.  The presentation of each dish was nice and the taste was unique and special.  Here are what we ordered:

Cebiche de Pescado - Fresh red snapper with red onions served with cancha, and Peruvian corn.  It was very good.  The fish was so fresh with the lime juice, very refreshing.  

Sanguchoń/sandwich - Pulled pork, salsa criolla, & sweet potatoes chips on a bun.  It was so good.  The portion was big, doesn't look like a small plate haha.  The porl was tender and juicy.  The sauce was flavorful and tasty.  

Pastel de Choclo - Peruvian corn cake with soffritto, queso fresco
Potato & mint, served with panca aioli.  It was very good.  Very special and unique taste.  

Fried Chicken - It was very good.  The chicken was crispy outside and juicy inside.  The meat was not dry at all.  Perfect with their house dipping sauce.  

Grilled Portobello - Very good.  Very unique taste.  

I love the sangria too.  Very tasty and refreshing.  

Too bad we both were too full for dessert.  

Overall, I had a wonderful and fun time there.  I am looking forward to come back soon.
author: Liza T.

description: I love peruvian food and Piqueos was one of my fav rest in the city.. till last night!! i went in with my brother in law. we had the ceviche mixto, anticuchos and Paella .. first ceviche isn't good like it used to be, paella wasn't tasty as before ( been coming here since 2008 ) but oh well we eat  it and everything was "oook" until i went to bed last night  .. woke up @ 3:20am with chills,growling/burning stomach,nausea and Vomiting .. I GOT FOOD POISONING :(  IDK maybe the ceviche or the paella wasn't fresh. it was a rough night for me i barely had any sleep ... I'll probably think it twice before coming back here ..
author: Marcela C.

description: Piqueo's has some of the finest Latin America and Peruvian food in San Francisco. I've been there about 15 times I've gone on dates there, I've also taken friends and family there and I'd have to say they enjoyed and wanted to come back. So with that being said just check them out there prettty good and there prices are very reasonable.
